Description: This rule checks if recaptcha_enabled is set to true. This ensures that only real users can submit applications in PCS.
Impact: If not enabled (default is false), it will not be possible to differentiate between human user and bot activity on PCS applications.

Description: This rule checks if a privacy policy is configured in PCS.
Impact: There will be no custom privacy policy shown in PCS.

Config Reference: Go to integrations/branding_config and: 1. Upload company logo 2. Verify logo URL is valid 3. Ensure logo displays correctly on career site
Description: Ensures that company logo is uploaded and configured. Logo URL must be a valid URL format and not empty or placeholder.
Impact: Career site will display without company logo, impacting brand recognition.

Description: This rule checks if customer domain is white labeled.

Config Reference: Go to integrations/branding_config and configure: 1. Primary color (valid hex format: #RRGGBB) 2. Secondary color 3. Preview changes on career site
Description: Ensures that brand colors are configured with valid hex color codes (e.g., #146da6). Empty or invalid color codes will cause styling issues.
Impact: Career site will use default colors instead of brand colors.

Config Reference: Go to integrations/career_hub_base_config > product_configs > employee and verify mobile configurations
Description: Ensures that mobile-specific configurations like hero images, banners, and layouts are correctly defined using device_configuration settings and display properly on mobile devices.
Impact: Mobile users may see blank spaces instead of images, broken layouts, or desktop-sized content that doesn't fit mobile screens.

Description: Ensures a valid company name is configured, maintaining professional branding on the PCS.
Impact: Proper branding builds trust and credibility among candidates.

Description: Confirms a company logo is uploaded to the navigation bar, reinforcing the brand identity across PCS.
Impact: A consistent logo improves the professional appearance of PCS and fosters user trust.

Description: This rule checks if favicons are configured.
Impact: The site will not have a favicon.

Description: This rule ensures a company logo URL is configured in PCSX branding and used as the default social/share image to maintain consistent employer branding across the careers site.
Impact: Missing or generic imagery in link previews and pages reduces brand trust and click-through.

Config Reference: PCS base configuration not enabled. Go to integrations/pcsx_base_config and set enabled: true.
Description: Ensures that PCS base configuration is present and enabled. This is the foundational config for all career site functionality.
Impact: Career site will not be accessible to candidates without base configuration.

Config Reference: Application form not configured. Go to integrations/pcsx_base_config > Apply Form and configure: 1. Required application fields 2. Optional fields 3. Field validation rules 4. Application workflow type
Description: Ensures that application form configuration exists, defining which fields candidates must complete and the application workflow.
Impact: Candidates cannot apply to positions without form configuration.

Rule Name: Careerhub Logged In Candidate Max Resume Size Bytes
Description: Ensures the maximum allowed size for resume uploads is configured for logged-in candidates in the Career Hub. This configuration helps prevent errors during job applications and enhances the user experience.
Impact: Missing or improperly configured resume size limits can result in upload failures, frustrating users and leading to increased drop-offs in the application process.

Config Reference: Login/signup not configured. Go to integrations/login_signup_config and configure: 1. Authentication method 2. Required signup fields 3. Email verification settings 4. Password requirements
Description: Ensures that login and signup configuration is valid, defining how candidates create accounts and authenticate.
Impact: Candidates cannot create accounts or log in without proper configuration.

Config Reference: Profile fields not configured. Go to integrations/candidate_profile_config and define profile fields: 1. Basic info 2. Experience fields 3. Education fields 4. Skills and certifications 5. Mark fields as required or optional
Description: Ensures that profile fields are defined, specifying what information candidates can display in their profiles.
Impact: Candidates will be unable to maintain a living profile with their latest skills, experience, education, etc., thereby impacting the quality of matching job recommendations.

Config Reference: Candidate profile not enabled. Go to integrations/candidate_profile_config and set enabled: true.
Description: Ensures that candidate profile configuration is enabled, allowing candidates to create and manage their profiles.
Impact: Candidates cannot create profiles or save information for future applications.

Description: This rule ensures that login functionality is enabled for candidates on the Personalised Career Site, allowing them to securely access their profiles, job matches, and applications. This feature provides candidates logged-in experience, providing personalization and enhanced engagement.
Impact: If this feature is not enabled (default is false), candidates will not have access to a logged-in experience, leading to a less personalized experience, potentially decreasing engagement and satisfaction.
Current Feature Name: Logged in PCS (with COP and Job Notifications)

Rule Name: Career Site dashboard should be provisioned
Description: Ensures the Career Site Dashboard is provisioned to provide insights into job views, applications, and overall site performance.
Impact: Missing dashboards reduce visibility into key metrics, limiting optimization opportunities.

Config Reference: Candidate copilot not enabled. Go to integrations/chatbotx_config and set enabled: true for candidate copilot.
Description: Ensures that candidate-facing copilot (chatbot) is configured and enabled, providing AI assistance to candidates.
Impact: Candidate copilot features will not be available on career site.

Config Reference: Custom domain not configured. Go to integrations/domain_whitelabeling_config and configure: 1. Custom domain name 2. Verify DNS CNAME record 3. Ensure SSL certificate is valid 4. Test domain accessibility
Description: Ensures that custom domain is configured with valid domain name format. DNS settings should be verified for proper routing.
Impact: Career site will use default Eightfold domain instead of company's branded domain.

Config Reference: SSL certificate issue detected. Go to integrations/domain_whitelabeling_config and verify: 1. SSL certificate is uploaded 2. Certificate matches domain name 3. Certificate is not expired 4. Certificate chain is complete
Description: Ensures that SSL certificate is present and valid for secure HTTPS access to career site.
Impact: Career site will show security warnings or be inaccessible via HTTPS.

Config Reference: Job alerts not enabled. Go to integrations/notification_config and enable job alerts for candidate product.
Description: Ensures that job alerts are configured and enabled in notification settings, allowing candidates to receive personalized job recommendations.
Impact: Candidates will not receive job alert emails.

Config Reference: Alert frequency not configured. Go to integrations/candidate_notifications_config and configure frequency options: 1. Daily 2. Weekly 3. Bi-weekly 4. Real-time
Description: Ensures that job alert frequency settings are configured, allowing candidates to choose how often they receive alerts.
Impact: Job alerts may send too frequently or not at all without frequency configuration.

Config Reference: Job feed not enabled. Go to integrations/job_feed_config and set enabled: true.
Description: Ensures that job feed configuration is enabled, allowing generation of XML feeds for job board distribution and SEO.
Impact: Jobs will not be distributed to job boards or search engines.

Config Reference: SEO not configured. Go to integrations/pcsx_base_config > SEO and configure: 1. Meta title and description templates 2. Structured data (JSON-LD) 3. Sitemap generation enabled 4. Canonical URLs 5. Open Graph tags
Description: Ensures that SEO configuration is valid, including meta tags, structured data markup, and sitemap settings for search engine optimization.
Impact: Career site will have poor search engine visibility and rankings.

Description: This rule checks if XML feeds (eg. for Indeed, Linkedin) are enabled. XML feeds improve job visibility by seamlessly connecting the PCS with major job boards like LinkedIn and Indeed, thereby attracting a broader range of candidates.
Impact: XML feeds will not be enabled, significantly reducing external job visibility on major job boards like LinkedIn and Indeed, which can lower application volume, increase time-to-fill, and limit access to a diverse candidate pipeline.

Description: At least one position is displayed in PCS.
Impact: No jobs will be shown in PCS.

Config Reference: Search not configured. Go to integrations/pcsx_base_config > Search and configure search settings: 1. Enable search functionality 2. Configure search filters 3. Set default search behavior 4. Configure sort options
Description: Ensures that search configuration is enabled, allowing candidates to search and filter jobs on career site.
Impact: Candidates cannot search for jobs effectively without search configuration.

Config Reference: Search filters missing. Go to integrations/pcsx_base_config > Search and configure filters: 1. Location/Geography 2. Department/Function 3. Job Type 4. Remote/Hybrid/Onsite 5. Experience Level
Description: Ensures that job search filters are configured, allowing candidates to refine search results by various criteria.
Impact: Candidates can search but cannot filter results, leading to poor user experience.

Description: Confirms PCS is enabled to offer a customized application experience to candidates.
Impact: An enabled PCS improves engagement, application efficiency, and the overall candidate experience.

Description: This rule checks if Talent Network is set up. This allows candidates visiting the career site to fill a form with key details and upload their resume, to be considered as a lead in future hiring pipelines.
Impact: If not set up, candidates will not be able to add themselves to the company's talent pool, to be considered as a lead and receive email notifications.

Config Reference: Talent network join not enabled. Go to integrations/smart_apply_config and enable talent network join option.
Description: Ensures that talent network join feature is enabled in smart apply configuration, allowing candidates to join without applying to specific positions.
Impact: Candidates cannot join talent network, limiting talent pool growth.

Config Reference: Join form not configured. Go to integrations/smart_apply_config and configure talent network form: 1. Required fields 2. Optional fields 3. Consent/privacy checkboxes 4. Form validation rules
Description: Ensures that talent network join form is configured, defining what information candidates provide when joining.
Impact: Join form may be incomplete or fail to capture necessary candidate information.

Config Reference: Landing pages not configured. Go to integrations/landing_config and initialize configuration.
Description: Ensures that landing page configuration is enabled, allowing upload and hosting of custom landing pages.
Impact: Custom landing pages cannot be created or accessed.

Config Reference: Landing page URLs invalid. Go to integrations/landing_config and verify: 1. Each landing page has valid URL path 2. URLs don't conflict with system routes 3. Pages are accessible via configured URLs 4. Redirects are properly configured if needed
Description: Ensures that landing pages have valid URLs configured and are accessible. URLs should follow proper format and routing.
Impact: Landing pages will be inaccessible via their intended URLs.

Config Reference: Microsite configuration incomplete. Go to integrations/pcsx_base_config > Microsites and verify each microsite has: 1. Unique identifier 2. Branding settings 3. Domain/subdomain mapping 4. Job filter rules 5. Navigation and footer customization
Description: Ensures that each microsite has complete configuration including branding, domain mapping, and job filters.
Impact: Microsites will not display correctly or show wrong job listings.

Description: Ensures that candidate login sessions, profiles, and applications are isolated between parent career site and microsites. Candidates should have separate accounts and application histories per microsite.
Impact: Candidates see applications from other microsites, branding bleeds across sites, and logout redirects to wrong site, creating confusion and poor experience.

Rule Name: People You May Work With Enabled
Config Reference: People You May Work With not enabled. Go to integrations/pcsx_base_config > position_details_config > sections_config and enable pymww_config section.
Description: Ensures that the People You May Work With feature is enabled on job detail pages, showing candidates potential future colleagues in the same team or department.
Impact: Candidates will not see potential colleagues on job pages, reducing engagement and transparency.

Config Reference: Go to integrations/pcsx_base_config > position_details_config > sections_config > pymww_config and add the fq for PYMWW results.
Description: Configures selection criteria for People You May Work With including: 1. Department/team matching 2. Location matching 3. Role level matching 4. Number of employees to display 5. Privacy/opt-in settings
Impact: PYMWW section will show irrelevant or no employees without proper criteria configuration.

Config Reference: Tracking scripts invalid. Go to integrations/tracking_pixel_config and verify: 1. JavaScript syntax is valid 2. Scripts are assigned to correct events 3. Third-party script URLs are accessible 4. Scripts don't conflict with each other 5. Test scripts in browser console
Description: Ensures that tracking scripts have valid JavaScript syntax and are configured to trigger on appropriate events (page load, application, etc.).
Impact: Tracking will fail or not trigger, causing data gaps in analytics.

Rule Name: PCS and TA Match Score Consistency
Description: Ensures that match scores displayed to candidates on PCS match the scores shown to recruiters in TA for the same candidate-job combination, preventing confusion and maintaining transparency.
Impact: Candidates see different match ratings on PCS than recruiters see in TA (e.g., 4.5 stars vs 'good match'), creating mistrust and inconsistent candidate experience.

Config Reference: Linkoff config is not enabled. Go to Integrations > pcsx_base_config > apply_form_config > link_off_apply_config and set enabled to true
Description: Ensures that Linkoff is configured and enabled.
Impact: Applications will be routed to smart apply flow.

Config Reference: Linkoff config is enabled but redirect url is not added. Go to Integrations > pcsx_base_config > apply_form_config > link_off_apply_config and add apply_redirect_url
Description: Ensures that Linkoff is enabled and configured to route to proper application link.
Impact: Applications will be routed to smart apply flow.

Config Reference: Smart Apply not enabled. Go to integrations/smart_apply_config and set enabled: true.
Description: Ensures that Smart Apply is configured and enabled with proper ATS integration settings for application sync.
Impact: Applications will not sync to ATS, breaking the recruiting workflow.

Config Reference: Field mapping incomplete. Go to integrations/smart_apply_config > Field Mapping and map all required fields: 1. Basic candidate info 2. Resume/CV 3. Application responses 4. Source tracking 5. Custom fields 6. Verify mappings with test application
Description: Ensures that field mappings are complete, defining how candidate data maps from Eightfold to ATS fields.
Impact: Application data will be incomplete or fail to sync to ATS.

Description: This rule ensures the maximum resume upload size for PCS application submissions is configured and enforced. Default is 20 MB (20971520 bytes).
Impact: If set higher than your ATS limit, uploads can be accepted by PCS but rejected by the ATS, causing failed applications. If set too low, candidates may be blocked from uploading valid resumes, increasing drop-offs and support burden.

Description: This rule checks if dedup_pos_questions is set to true in smart_apply_config (Talent Experience > Referrals & Talent Network). This ensures that questions across multiple positions in the job cart are deduplicated when candidates apply for multiple jobs. By reducing redundancy, this feature streamlines the application process, making it more efficient and user-friendly.
Impact: If not enabled (default is false), candidates may face duplicate questions when applying to multiple positions, leading to frustration and higher application drop-off rates.
Notes: Please move this to pcsx_base_config

Description: This rule checks if smart_apply_config > upload_resume_before_apply is set to true (Talent Experience > Referrals & Talent Network).
Impact: If not set to true (default is true), candidates will be able to submit applications without uploading a resume.
Notes: Please move this to pcsx_base_config

Description: This rule ensures that pcx_base_config > search_config > strong_match_threshold is configured to define the minimum criteria for matching candidates to job roles. This prevents irrelevant or poorly matched candidates from being displayed as potential applicants. (Talent Experience > PCS IX)
Impact: Without configuring this threshold, the system may surface irrelevant matches, leading to poor candidate and recruiter experiences.
Notes: strong_match_threshold

Description: This rule checks if referrer_src_map or/and add_application_sources is/are configured with valid source ids.

Config Reference: Smart referrals not enabled. Go to integrations/smart_apply_config and enable referrals functionality.
Description: Ensures that smart referral feature is configured and enabled, allowing employees to refer candidates with AI matching.
Impact: Employee referral functionality will not be available.

Config Reference: Referral workflow not configured. Go to integrations/smart_apply_config > Referrals and configure: 1. Referral submission form 2. Status tracking and notifications 3. Reward/incentive rules 4. Referral approval workflow 5. Dashboard for employees to track referrals
Description: Ensures that referral workflow is configured, defining how referrals are submitted, tracked, and potentially rewarded.
Impact: Referral process will be incomplete or confusing for employees.

Config Reference: Source parameters not configured. Go to integrations/source_map_config and configure: 1. UTM parameter mapping 2. Referral source codes 3. Default source assignment 4. Source taxonomy/hierarchy 5. Source persistence settings
Description: Ensures that source tracking parameters are configured, defining how different sources are identified and tracked (UTM params, referral codes, etc.).
Impact: Sources will not be captured correctly, leading to inaccurate attribution.

Config Reference: Source tracking not enabled. Go to integrations/pcsx_base_config > Source Tracking and set enabled: true.
Description: Ensures that source tracking is configured and enabled, capturing where candidates come from before applying.
Impact: Cannot track recruitment marketing effectiveness or candidate sources.

Config Reference: Source sync not configured. Go to integrations/smart_apply_config > Source Mapping and configure source field mapping to ATS source field.
Description: Ensures that source tracking data is mapped to sync with applications to the ATS, maintaining source attribution.
Impact: Source tracking data will be lost when applications sync to ATS.

Config Reference: Withdraw functionality not enabled. Go to integrations/pcsx_base_config > Applications and enable withdraw application option.
Description: Ensures that withdraw application feature is enabled, allowing candidates to withdraw their applications.
Impact: Candidates cannot withdraw applications, leading to poor candidate experience.

Config Reference: Withdraw workflow not configured. Go to integrations/pcsx_base_config > Applications > Withdraw and configure: 1. Confirmation dialog 2. Sync to ATS when withdrawn 3. Candidate notification/confirmation email 4. Withdrawal reason collection 5. Grace period for un-withdrawing
Description: Ensures that withdraw workflow is properly configured, including confirmation dialog, ATS sync, and candidate notification.
Impact: Withdrawals may not sync to ATS or candidates may withdraw accidentally without confirmation.

Config Reference: email_config is missing or null. Go to integrations/email_config and verify the configuration exists and is saved.
Description: Ensures 'reply_to_domain' and 'send_from_domain' are complete and valid.
Notes: Instead of checking if the email_config has object or not, we should check for 'reply_to_domain' and 'send_from_domain'

Rule Name: The user has permission to send messages but does not have a communication email set
Description: This function ensures that all users with the PERM_SEND_MESSAGES role permission are properly configured to send communications. It validates that each user has a designated communication email, verifies that the address is authorized for use, and flags any users who lack the appropriate configuration.

Config Reference: SMS integration not configured. Go to integrations/email_config and verify: 1. SMS provider is selected (e.g., Twilio) 2. Provider credentials (API key, auth token) are configured 3. From phone number is set and verified 4. SMS feature is enabled
Description: Ensures that SMS integration is enabled with valid provider configuration (Twilio, etc.). SMS provider credentials and phone number must be configured.
Impact: SMS messages cannot be sent without provider configuration.

Description: Verifies that communication channels (sms, whatsapp) are configured for interview scheduling to ensure smooth communication between interviewers and candidates.
Impact: Missing configurations for communication channels can disrupt scheduling, reducing interview efficiency.
Notes: Rule needs to take into account customers that have NOT enabled other communication channels (SMS or Whatsapp).

Config Reference: WhatsApp integration not configured. Go to integrations/email_config and verify: 1. WhatsApp Business API provider is configured 2. Business phone number is verified 3. API credentials are valid 4. WhatsApp messaging is enabled. Note: Requires third-party agreement with WhatsApp BSP
Description: Ensures that WhatsApp Business API integration is configured with provider credentials and phone number.
Impact: WhatsApp messages cannot be sent without provider configuration.
Notes: Check for whatsapp_twilio_account_sid, whatsapp_twilio_auth_token, whatsapp_twilio_messaging_service_id

Description: This rule verifies the presence of the Leads Workflow tab in the pipeline page.
Impact: The Leads Workflow tab on the pipeline page is the initial touchpoint for recruiters as they begin filling positions. Ensuring this tab is available and properly configured is essential for a smooth recruitment process and recruiter productivity.

Description: This rule verifies the presence of the Applicant Workflow tab on the pipeline page.
Impact: The Applicant Workflow tab lists all candidates who have applied or are under consideration for a job requisition. It serves as a central workspace to reviewing and advancing applicants efficiently, ensuring a streamlined recruitment process.
Notes: With this rule, would it be possible to run a report on against the current configuration to identify the base requirements (ie Contacted, Applicants flows are missing)

Rule Name: Successful Application Stage Advances Per Job Req Template
Description: Every job requisition template must achieve at least a 90% success rate when advancing stages from Eightfold to the external system. If the stage transition map is configured correctly, stage advances should not fail.

Config Reference: Profile sections not configured. Go to integrations/profile_display_config and ensure at least these sections are enabled: 1. Overview 2. Experience 3. Education 4. Skills
Description: Ensures that key profile sections are defined and enabled. At minimum, overview section should be present.
Impact: Profile information cannot be displayed to recruiters without section configuration.

Config Reference: Copilot capabilities not configured. Go to integrations/copilot_capability_config and enable at least one capability (e.g., job_description_generation, scheduling_assistant).
Description: Ensures that specific Copilot capabilities (job description generation, scheduling assistance, etc.) are enabled in capability configuration.
Impact: Copilot will be enabled but have no usable features.

Config Reference: Copilot not enabled. Go to integrations/copilot_config and set enabled: true.
Description: Ensures that Copilot feature is enabled in configuration. Copilot must be explicitly enabled before use.
Impact: Copilot features will not be accessible to users.

Config Reference: Diversity configuration missing. Go to integrations/diversity_config and initialize the configuration.
Description: Ensures that diversity configuration object exists. This config controls bias reduction features like profile masking.
Impact: Diversity and bias reduction features cannot function without configuration.

Config Reference: Masking fields not configured. Go to integrations/diversity_config and specify which fields to mask (e.g., age, gender, ethnicity, educational_background).
Description: Ensures that if profile masking is enabled, specific fields are configured to be masked (age, gender, ethnicity, etc.).
Impact: Masking feature will be enabled but no fields will actually be masked, defeating the purpose.

Description: Ensures that anonymization rules are correctly configured to automatically anonymize candidate profiles based on defined criteria (e.g., event end date, inactivity period, talent network opt-out).
Impact: Candidate data may not be anonymized according to compliance requirements, creating data privacy and regulatory risks.

Config Reference: Global search not enabled. Go to integrations/global_search_config and set enabled: true.
Description: Ensures that global search feature is enabled in configuration, allowing recruiters to search across the talent network.
Impact: Recruiters cannot search for candidates without global search enabled.

Config Reference: Search filters not configured. Go to integrations/global_search_config and configure filters for: 1. Location 2. Skills 3. Experience/Seniority 4. Current Company 5. Job Title
Description: Ensures that search filters are configured, allowing recruiters to refine searches by location, skills, experience, contact_consent etc.
Impact: Search results cannot be filtered effectively without filter configuration.
Notes: Added contact_consent to description

Description: Defines the columns, display names, fields, formatting, and widths for the consolidated feedback report. This ensures the report is well-structured, visually clear, and easily interpretable by recruiters, hiring managers, and other stakeholders.
Impact: Properly configured columns and formatting improve the usability and professionalism of the feedback report, enabling better hiring decisions and streamlined evaluation processes.

Description: Configures the list of columns displayed on the feedback dashboard to provide relevant and actionable information to users. Each column represents a key attribute related to the feedback process, ensuring clarity and usability of the dashboard.
Impact: Missing or improperly configured columns can result in incomplete or irrelevant data being displayed, reducing the dashboard's effectiveness and user efficiency.

Config Reference: Feedback forms not configured. Go to integrations/interview_feedback_config and create at least one feedback form template with questions.
Description: Ensures that feedback form templates are configured. Forms define the structure and questions for interview feedback.
Impact: Interviewers cannot submit feedback without form templates.

Config Reference: Interview feedback not configured. Go to integrations/interview_feedback_config and set enabled: true.
Description: Ensures that interview feedback feature is configured and enabled, allowing interviewers to submit structured feedback.
Impact: Interview feedback cannot be collected without configuration.

Description: Ensures a default interview timezone is configured for scenarios where user-defined or calendar-specific timezones are unavailable. This avoids scheduling errors and confusion caused by timezone mismatches.
Impact: Missing timezone configuration can lead to scheduling inaccuracies, affecting candidate and interviewer availability.

Description: Ensures the scheduling action is enabled on the profile or pipeline page, allowing recruiters to initiate interview scheduling directly.
Impact: If not enabled, recruiters cannot initiate the scheduling process, leading to delays and inefficiencies in interview coordination.

Config Reference: Calendar integration not configured. Go to integrations/scheduling_config and configure: 1. Calendar provider (Google/Outlook/Exchange) 2. OAuth credentials or API keys 3. Service account or connection settings 4. Test the integration to verify connectivity
Description: Ensures that calendar integration is configured with provider credentials. Integration is required for checking availability and creating calendar events.
Impact: System cannot create calendar events or check interviewer availability.
Notes: Calendar integration doesn't require provider credentials setup. Check: Branding Config, Company Name, Calendar Provider, Availability, minSchedulingNoticeSeconds, Preferences, interviewDurationOptions

Description: Ensures that filters in the Scheduling Center (hiring manager, location, etc.) have appropriate facet limits and autocomplete configurations to display all relevant options.
Impact: Users may only see a limited subset of hiring managers or locations in filters, making it difficult to find and schedule interviews for all positions.
Notes: Default config not exposed in Admin Console. May get consistent pass/fail depending on check logic

Config Reference: Scheduling templates not found. Go to integrations/scheduling_config and create at least one template with: 1. Template name 2. Interview duration 3. Interview type/stage 4. Required participants
Description: Ensures that scheduling templates are configured, defining interview types, durations, and participant roles.
Impact: Interviews cannot be scheduled without templates defining the structure.

Description: Ensures that role permissions for scheduling templates are correctly configured. Users with 'perm_admin_email_scheduling_templates' should be able to view, edit, and manage all scheduling templates.
Impact: Users may not be able to edit templates even when they have the correct permission, blocking scheduling workflow setup and management.

Config Reference: Scheduling configuration not enabled. Go to integrations/scheduling_config and set enabled: true.
Description: Ensures that smart scheduling feature is configured and enabled, allowing automated interview scheduling.
Impact: Interview scheduling features cannot be used without configuration.

Description: Ensures a calendar provider (e.g., Google Calendar, Microsoft Outlook 365) is configured to enable seamless interview scheduling and synchronization with interviewers' and candidates' calendars.
Impact: Without a configured calendar provider, the system cannot synchronize interviews, requiring manual scheduling and leading to inefficiencies.

Config Reference: Workflow automation not enabled. Go to integrations/workflow_automation_config and set enabled: true.
Description: Ensures that workflow automation feature is configured and enabled, allowing creation of automated candidate workflows.
Impact: Workflow automation features are not available to users.

Config Reference: Workflow triggers not configured. Go to workflows and configure triggers with: 1. Valid trigger event (stage_change, application_submitted, etc.) 2. Trigger conditions 3. Associated workflow actions
Description: Ensures that at least one workflow trigger is configured. Triggers define when workflows execute (stage change, application, etc.).
Impact: Workflows cannot execute without trigger configuration.

Description: Configures a clear and actionable message displayed when the Communities feature is disabled, ensuring users understand why it is unavailable and what steps they can take.
Impact: Without this configuration, users may be confused about the feature's unavailability, leading to frustration or support tickets.

Description: Ensures that reminders set by users on a candidate's profile are visible across all platforms, including the EF extension, to prevent duplicate outreach or conflicting engagements. This feature enables team-wide collaboration and reduces redundant communication.
Impact: Without this configuration, team members may unknowingly duplicate efforts, resulting in poor candidate experience and inefficient use of sourcing resources.

Description: Ensures that the hostname is set in the app_configs section of extension config for linkedin, naukri and github.
Impact: Missing hostname configuration can prevent proper interaction with specific websites, impacting functionality such as profile parsing and candidate engagement.

Description: Ensures that all actions and sub-actions are correctly set up so recruiters and sourcers have a smooth, intuitive experience managing candidates. These actions include saving candidates, updating statuses, setting reminders, and performing other key functions within the platform and browser extensions.
Impact: If actions are missing or misconfigured, recruiters may be unable to manage candidates efficiently, leading to workflow delays, errors, and reduced team collaboration.

Config Reference: Event recruiting not enabled. Go to integrations/planned_event_config and set enabled: true.
Description: Ensures that event recruiting feature is configured and enabled, allowing creation and management of recruiting events.
Impact: Event recruiting features are not accessible.

Config Reference: Event stages not configured. Go to integrations/planned_event_workflow_config and define event stages (e.g., Registered, Attended, Interviewed, Shortlisted).
Description: Ensures that event-specific pipeline stages are configured, defining how candidates progress through event recruiting.
Impact: Candidates in events cannot be moved through stages without configuration.

Config Reference: Event home configuration invalid. Go to integrations/planned_event_home_config and configure display settings for event listing.
Description: Ensures that event home configuration is set up, controlling how events are displayed and listed in the UI.
Impact: Events list may not display correctly to recruiters.

Description: Ensures that when assessment requests fail and candidates are moved to Assessment Error stage, the error message is captured in the candidate's external_custom_info and displayed in the Assessment Error view.
Impact: Recruiters cannot see why assessment requests failed, making it difficult to troubleshoot and retry assessments, leading to candidate pipeline delays.

Description: Ensures that event assessment triggers are configured to pass all required fields to external assessment systems, including action_user_email, regardless of whether triggered from event pipeline or position pipeline.
Impact: Assessment triggers may fail or send incomplete data to third-party systems, preventing proper tracking of who initiated assessments and breaking downstream reporting.

Config Reference: Smart campaigns not enabled. Go to integrations/campaign_config and set enabled: true.
Description: Ensures that smart campaigns feature is configured and enabled, allowing creation of candidate nurture campaigns.
Impact: Campaign features are not accessible to users.

Config Reference: Campaign templates not found. Go to integrations/email_templates and create templates for campaign use (tagged as campaign_email).
Description: Ensures that email templates specific to campaigns are configured for candidate outreach.
Impact: Campaigns cannot send emails without templates.
Notes: System should check for at least 1 associated campaign template is configured in the system

Config Reference: Talent communities not enabled. Go to integrations/community_home_config and set enabled: true.
Description: Ensures that talent communities feature is configured and enabled, allowing creation and management of talent pools.
Impact: Talent communities features are not accessible.

Config Reference: Community stages not configured. Go to integrations/community_workflow_config and define stages for community member progression.
Description: Ensures that community pipeline stages are configured, defining how candidates progress within talent communities.
Impact: Community members cannot be managed through stages.

Description: This rule verifies that the Community Home page is correctly configured by ensuring the presence and validity of the key objects, available_filters, filter_to_fq_data_map, and columns in community_home_config.
Impact: These configurations ensure the Community Home page functions as a unified dashboard for recruiters to manage and analyze all talent communities. Missing components can render the feature non-functional or significantly impair talent sourcing.
Notes: Currently only checks available_filters. Should also check filter_to_fq_data_map and columns

Description: Verifies that community_workflow_config is defined per community type with a valid display_name and non-empty workflow steps.
Impact: Ensures Community pipelines render and function correctly, stages appear in the UI, community types display consistently, and stage progressions/automations work. Without this, communities can't progress prospects or reflect status, breaking sourcing workflows.

Feature Alignment: Core Talent Management (Employee Profiles and Career Hub homepage)
Description: Checks whether at least 75% of employee profiles have at least one skill added, ensuring profiles are enriched for recommendations and skill-based workflows.
Impact: Insufficient skills on profiles will reduce the effectiveness of recommendations and insights across Talent Management modules.

Feature Alignment: Core Talent Management (Employee Profiles and Career Hub homepage)
Description: Ensures the filter list for recommended jobs in Career Hub is configured. This feed shows jobs personalized for the employee based on their profile and preferences.
Impact: If not configured, employees may receive irrelevant job recommendations, reducing engagement with the Career Hub.

Feature Alignment: Core Talent Management (Employee Profiles and Career Hub homepage)
Description: Ensures the filter list for similar people recommendations in Career Hub is configured. This feature shows employees other people with similar current or target titles for networking and exploration.
Impact: If not configured, employees may see irrelevant recommendations or fail to see potential peers, reducing the utility of Career Hub.

Feature Alignment: Core Talent Management (Employee Profiles and Career Hub homepage)
Rule Name: Career Hub Home Page Card Configuration
Config Reference: Home page feature cards may be disabled. Go to integrations/career_hub_base_config > product_configs > employee and verify: 1. In 'home_page_config' > 'cards', enable desired feature cards 2. For Mentors: ensure 'recommended_mentors' card is enabled 3. For Courses: ensure 'recommended_courses' card is enabled 4. For Career Navigator: ensure 'career_navigator_tour' card is enabled 5. Check card display order and personalization settings
Description: Ensures that key Career Hub feature cards are enabled and visible on the employee home page, including Mentors, Courses, Career Navigator Tour, and other discovery features.
Impact: Important Career Hub features are not visible to employees on their home page, reducing feature discoverability and adoption.

Feature Alignment: Core Talent Management (Employee Profiles and Career Hub homepage)
Description: Checks whether employee engagement features are enabled in Career Hub to track and encourage participation in upskilling/development plan workflows.
Impact: If not enabled, employee engagement tracking and related workflows will not function, reducing visibility into participation.

Feature Alignment: Core Talent Management (Employee Profiles and Career Hub homepage)
Description: Ensures that employee hiring bands are set up and linked to the correct seniority levels in the calibration settings. This aligns employees and roles by level, enabling accurate search, recommendations, and analytics.
Impact: Missing or incorrect bands can lead to mismatched job recommendations, broken filters, inaccurate seniority-based indexing, and will also affect mentorship recommendations if hiring bands are not configured.

Rule Name: Upskilling tab exists under own profile page
Description: Checks whether the Upskilling tab is configured to appear under the employee's own profile page, enabling employees to view and manage upskilling plans within Career Hub.
Impact: If not configured, employees will not see the Upskilling tab, reducing visibility into upskilling opportunities.

Description: Tracks the percentage of courses with associated skills, ensuring course suggestions for upskilling plans, career navigator paths & course recommendations are relevant and skills-based.
Impact: Low skill mapping reduces the effectiveness of course recommendations across TM.

Description: Ensures the 'My Courses' section is available in the Career Hub navigation bar, providing employees with access to assigned, in-progress, and completed courses in one place.
Impact: If missing, employees may struggle to track learning progress or locate relevant courses, reducing participation in development initiatives.

Description: Ensures the 'Courses Explore' feature is enabled, allowing employees to browse and search for courses using various filters to discover learning opportunities aligned with their goals.
Impact: If not enabled, employees may struggle to find relevant courses, reducing participation in learning initiatives.

Description: Ensures courses are integrated into Global Search, allowing employees to find relevant courses alongside other entities within the platform.
Impact: If not enabled, employees may find it difficult to search for courses, reducing participation in development programs.

Rule Name: More than {{ metric_data_json.min_threshold }}% of employees should have level
Description: Checks whether most employees have a level defined in their profiles. Levels are used to infer employee seniority and help auto-initialize roles with the appropriate seniority for planning and mobility workflows.
Impact: Missing level data affects seniority inference, which can break key features like matching, recommendations, and role creation logic.

Rule Name: More than {{ metric_data_json.min_threshold }}% of employees should have their associated levels defined in Internal mobility config
Description: Checks if employee levels are defined in the Internal Mobility configuration, which is critical for role hierarchy and accurate matching in Career Navigator.
Impact: Missing level configurations can lead to incorrect eligibility calculations and limit internal mobility workflows.

Rule Name: More than {{ metric_data_json.min_threshold }}% of employees should have job code
Description: Checks whether employees have job codes defined in their profiles. Job codes are critical in Talent Management for succession planning, Career Navigator, and linking employees to roles. They also help auto-initialize roles based on employee count.
Impact: If job codes are missing, role mapping and initialization may fail, affecting downstream workflows like succession tracking and internal mobility visibility.

Description: Checks whether most employees have a Business Unit (BU) defined in their profiles. This field is essential for organizational grouping, permissioning, analytics, and segmentation in Talent Management workflows.
Impact: Missing Business Unit values can lead to misaligned access permissions, broken analytics, and ineffective organizational grouping in the platform.

Rule Name: More than {{ metric_data_json.min_threshold }}% of positions should have hiring_band
Description: Checks whether most positions have a hiring band defined. Hiring bands are critical for enabling job recommendations within the eligible band range, based on the employee's level.
Impact: Missing hiring band data prevents accurate job recommendations and breaks band-based eligibility logic in Career Hub workflows.

Rule Name: More than {{ metric_data_json.min_threshold }}% of employees should have location
Description: Checks whether most employees have a location defined in their profile. Employee location is essential for accurate job recommendations, geo-based insights, and experience personalization.
Impact: Missing location data limits personalized experiences, reduces relevance of job recommendations, and may affect location-based reporting and permissions.

Rule Name: More than {{ metric_data_json.min_threshold }}% of employees should have hiring_date
Description: Checks whether most employees have a hiring date defined in their profile. Hiring date is essential for tenure calculations, workforce analysis, and insights related to attrition and experience.
Impact: Missing hiring dates can impact employee tenure analytics, reduce accuracy of workforce reports, and affect downstream features such as retention tracking.

Rule Name: More than {{ metric_data_json.min_threshold }}% of employees should have seniority level
Description: Checks whether most employees have a seniority level derived from their current title. Seniority is essential for talent management workflows, influencing job recommendations, benchmarking, and succession planning.
Impact: Missing seniority levels can lead to inaccurate matching, ineffective internal mobility recommendations, and breakdowns in career pathing logic.

Rule Name: More than {{ metric_data_json.min_threshold }}% of employees should have lob (Line of Business)
Description: Checks whether most employees have a defined division (Line of Business). Division data is crucial for understanding employee roles and for auto-initializing role business functions in career and mobility workflows.
Impact: Missing division (LOB) values may result in inaccurate role mapping and broken logic for career pathing, recommendations, and workforce planning.

Rule Name: More than {{ metric_data_json.min_threshold }}% of roles should have job code
Description: Checks whether most roles have a job code defined. Job codes uniquely identify roles and enable Talent Management products to map employees to the correct roles and support accurate succession, pipeline, and mobility workflows.
Impact: Missing job codes for roles can break employee-role mapping, reduce matching accuracy, and affect downstream processes that rely on role uniqueness.

Rule Name: More than {{ metric_data_json.min_threshold }}% of roles should have titles
Description: Checks whether most roles have titles defined. Titles are critical for all roles as they drive recommendations and support matching in Talent Management modules like Career Navigator.
Impact: Missing role titles can break job matching, reduce recommendation quality, and impact visibility in career planning workflows.

Rule Name: More than {{ metric_data_json.min_threshold }}% of roles should have an associated level
Description: Checks whether most roles have an associated level defined. Levels help determine role seniority and hierarchy, supporting accurate recommendations and career pathing in Talent Management modules like Career Navigator.
Impact: Missing role levels can break seniority inference, reduce the effectiveness of matching and recommendations, and affect career planning workflows.

Rule Name: More than {{ metric_data_json.min_threshold }}% of roles should have their associated levels defined in Internal mobility config
Description: Checks whether most roles have their associated levels defined in the Internal Mobility configuration. This setup is critical for understanding role hierarchy and supporting eligibility, matching, and internal mobility workflows.
Impact: Missing role levels in the configuration can lead to incorrect eligibility checks, poor matching, and breakdowns in career planning workflows.

Rule Name: More than {{ metric_data_json.min_threshold }}% of roles should have business function
Description: Checks whether most roles have a business function defined. Business functions help determine the domain of a role and influence job recommendations and matching in Career Navigator and other Talent Management modules.
Impact: Missing business function data can reduce the quality of recommendations, affect domain-based matching, and break role grouping in career planning workflows.

Rule Name: More than {{ metric_data_json.min_threshold }}% of projects should have skills
Description: Checks whether most projects have skills tagged. Associating skills with projects helps showcase employee capabilities, supports accurate skill mapping, and improves internal mobility and development planning.
Impact: Projects without skills reduce the platform's ability to infer employee capabilities, impacting skill-based recommendations and visibility in internal searches.

Rule Name: More than {{ metric_data_json.min_threshold }}% of employees should have manager email
Description: Checks that most employees have their manager's email address. Manager emails are needed to show who reports to whom, create org charts, and control access based on management levels.
Impact: Without manager emails, org charts will be incomplete, manager-based features won't work properly, and skills assessments (which require manager assessment) will be incomplete.

Description: Checks whether most employees have a valid manager email assigned. A valid manager email must match the email of an existing employee profile. This is required to build accurate org charts and enforce permission rules based on managerial relationships.
Impact: If manager emails are missing or invalid, org charts may be incomplete, and features relying on manager-based permissions (like approvals and insights) may not function correctly.
Notes: Rule checks for the presence of an email. Absence of an email is treated as invalid. True email validity check would be checking for email domain name.

Rule Name: More than {{ metric_data_json.min_threshold }}% of employees should not be thin profiles
Description: Rich employee profiles are essential for accurate job matching, high-quality recommendations, and meaningful workforce insights.
Impact: When too many employees have basic profiles with minimal information, Talent Management features become less effective, recommendations lose quality, and analytics become less accurate and useful. This metric passes when at least 95% of employees have enriched profiles.
Notes: The rule can be stated positively instead of negation. Eg: At least 95% of employees should have enriched profiles

Rule Name: More than {{ metric_data_json.min_threshold }}% of courses should have skills
Description: Checks whether most courses have skills tagged. Skills are essential for delivering accurate course recommendations, enabling skill-based learning paths, and improving the relevance of suggestions within Talent Management workflows.
Impact: Courses without skills cannot be recommended effectively, reducing the quality of learning paths and personalized suggestions for employees.
Notes: The rule does not specifically track for presense of skills. This should be added.

Rule Name: More than {{ metric_data_json.min_threshold }}% of courses should have title
Description: Checks whether most courses have a title defined. Course titles are essential for identifying content, improving discoverability, and inferring skills that employees can learn from the course.
Impact: Courses without titles are difficult to identify and cannot be used effectively for recommendations, reducing engagement with learning resources.
Notes: The rule may not be working as expected. Even if course.title is present, the rule flags as fail.

Rule Name: More than {{ metric_data_json.min_threshold }}% of courses should have relevant (50+ words) description
Description: Checks whether most courses have a relevant description of at least 50 words. Course descriptions help employees understand course content and are used to infer skills associated with the course for recommendations.
Impact: Courses without sufficient descriptions are harder to discover, reduce learner engagement, and limit the platform's ability to map skills for personalized recommendations.
Notes: The rule may not be working as expected. Even if course.description is present, the rule flags as fail.

Rule Name: More than {{ metric_data_json.min_threshold }}% of projects should have title
Description: Checks whether most projects have a title defined. Project titles are important for identifying and showcasing work, enabling discoverability and supporting career development conversations.
Impact: Projects without titles are harder to identify, reducing their visibility within employee profiles and limiting their use in growth and development planning.

Rule Name: More than {{ metric_data_json.min_threshold }}% of projects should have description
Description: Checks whether most projects have a description provided. Project descriptions add context to employees' work, making it easier to showcase contributions and align them with skill development and career goals.
Impact: Projects without descriptions provide limited value in profiles, reducing visibility in internal searches and weakening career development insights.
Notes: Passing Rule needs to be reviewed. I found a rule that said 26 out of 64 had description. But the passing rule had 0 projects.

Feature Alignment: Internal Mobility (One-Click Apply or redirect to ATS for employees)
Description: Checks that the redirect URL configuration for job applications in Internal Mobility is set. If apply_through_api is not supported by the ATS, the system should redirect employees using apply_url_template or apply_url_config.
Impact: If not configured, employees may face issues applying to jobs, leading to application failures and frustration.

Feature Alignment: Internal Mobility (One-Click Apply or redirect to ATS for employees)
Rule Name: Careerhub employee max resume size bytes
Description: Ensures the maximum allowed resume upload size for job applications in Career Hub is configured. Setting this value prevents upload errors, enabling a smooth application experience for employees.
Impact: If not configured, users may encounter errors when uploading large resumes, leading to frustration and potential drop-offs during the application process.

Feature Alignment: Internal Mobility (One-Click Apply or redirect to ATS for employees)
Rule Name: Careerhub employee allowed file extensions for resume
Description: Ensures that the allowed file extensions for resume uploads are properly configured in Career Hub for employees. This prevents upload errors, ensures compatibility, and supports a seamless user experience during job applications.
Impact: If not configured, employees may encounter errors when uploading resumes, leading to frustration and lower participation in career site activities.

Feature Alignment: Internal Mobility (One-Click Apply or redirect to ATS for employees)
Description: Job bands must be set up to show the role levels in your organization. They help determine which employees qualify for which roles and enable internal job movement.
Impact: Without proper job bands, employees won't be matched to the right positions and career navigation will not work as expected.

Feature Alignment: Internal Mobility (One-Click Apply or redirect to ATS for employees)
Description: Ensures that hiring band equivalencies are defined to logically group job bands across levels. This supports accurate eligibility checks and enables employees to apply for roles outside their exact job band when appropriate.
Impact: Without equivalencies, eligibility rules may be applied inconsistently, limiting internal mobility and reducing confidence in recommendations.
Notes: Adding Navigation might help: Talent Management > Internal Mobility

Feature Alignment: Internal Mobility (One-Click Apply or redirect to ATS for employees)
Description: Ensures that the hiring band filter is enabled on the employee home page. This filter shows employees only the jobs they are eligible for based on their band, improving the quality of recommendations.
Impact: If this filter is disabled (default is 0), employees may see jobs they are not eligible for, which can lead to confusion, lower engagement, and poor overall experience in the Career Hub.
Notes: Add the config where key is found: Talent Management > Internal Mobility > hiring_band_filtering

Description: Checks if the 'User Name' type navigation link is configured for the mobile app to enable user navigation in the app interface.
Impact: If missing, users may not have appropriate navigation in the mobile app.

Description: Ensures the position filter query (fq) is configured for Smart Apply in Career Site and Referrals, allowing proper filtering of positions during referral and application workflows.
Impact: Without this configuration, referrals and applications may surface irrelevant positions, reducing the effectiveness of Smart Referrals.

Description: Checks whether the 'My Referrals' section is present in the Career Hub navigation bar, allowing employees to view and manage their referrals easily.
Impact: Without this section, employees may be unable to track their referral activities, reducing participation in referral programs.

Description: Ensures the 'My Referrals' configuration is present within Career Hub, enabling employees to access and manage their referrals effectively.
Impact: Without this configuration, employees will not have visibility into their referrals, limiting engagement in referral workflows.

Description: Checks whether skill proficiency tracking is configured for Skill Assessments when role skills are enabled in Career Hub.
Impact: Without this configuration, tracking employee proficiency in role-related skills during assessments will not function, reducing upskilling effectiveness.
Current Feature Name: Skill Assessments v2 with role skills enabled

Description: Checks whether Skill Assessments are configured on the employee profile page, enabling direct access for employees to complete assessments aligned with role skills.
Impact: If not configured, employees will not see Skill Assessments on their profiles, reducing participation and tracking.
Current Feature Name: Skill Assessments v2 with role skills enabled

Description: Checks whether access checks for Skill Assessments are enabled in Career Hub, allowing controlled access to assessment workflows.
Impact: Without this configuration, skill assessments may not respect access rules, leading to inconsistent user experience.

Rule Name: More than {{ metric_data_json.min_threshold }}% of employees should have manager email
Description: Checks whether most employees have a manager email defined, which is essential for building accurate org charts and enabling manager-based data permissions in Talent Management workflows.
Impact: Missing manager emails disrupt org chart generation, reduce reporting accuracy, and limit manager-based workflows.

Rule Name: More than {{ metric_data_json.min_threshold }}% of employees should have manager_id
Description: Checks whether most employees have a manager_userid defined, which is critical for generating accurate org charts and enabling manager-based workflows in Talent Management.
Impact: Missing manager_userid prevents the system from constructing org charts and disrupts manager-based reporting and workflows.

Description: Ensures projects are integrated into Global Search so employees can search for project opportunities using platform-wide filters.
Impact: Without this, employees may be unable to find relevant projects, reducing participation in project-based development.

Description: Ensures the 'Projects Explore' feature is configured, allowing employees to browse and discover projects aligned with their interests and skills.
Impact: If not enabled, employees may struggle to find suitable project opportunities.

Description: Checks whether the 'Recommended Projects' feed is configured in the order of feeds, ensuring employees see project recommendations on their Career Hub home page.
Impact: Without this feed, employees may miss project opportunities relevant to their development goals.

Rule Name: Upskilling tab exists under own profile page
Description: Checks whether the Upskilling tab is configured under the employee's profile page for organization-led upskilling workflows in Career Hub.
Impact: Without this configuration, employees will not see the Upskilling tab, limiting access to org-led upskilling plans.
Notes: Repurpose as check for template management option available to HRBP/Talent admin

Description: Checks whether the Upskilling link is present in the top navigation bar when org led upskilling is enabled in Career Hub to allow easy access to upskilling opportunities.
Impact: If not configured, employees will not see the Upskilling link in the top navigation, reducing discoverability and usage of upskilling features.
Notes: Only relevant when using org led upskilling

Description: Checks whether employees are assigned to roles in Talent Design, which is necessary for identifying required skills and aligning them with succession planning and development workflows.
Impact: Without role assignments, the system cannot determine required skills for employees, reducing the accuracy of planning and upskilling workflows.

Rule Name: More than {{ metric_data_json.min_threshold }}% of roles should have at least 3 skills
Description: Checks whether most roles have at least 3 skills defined, ensuring role requirements are captured accurately for succession planning and recommendations in Talent Management workflows.
Impact: Roles with fewer than 3 skills will reduce the quality of recommendations and benchmarking across succession planning workflows.

Description: Checks that users with HRBP (Human Resources Business Partner) permissions are created to access HRBP features within the system.
Impact: Without HRBP user assignments, HRBP-specific features will not be accessible to the intended users, limiting HR's ability to manage and oversee talent processes.

Description: Ensures the 'Position Only Succession Plan' configuration is enabled within Succession Planning, which restricts planning to position-based succession workflows.
Impact: Without this configuration, the system will not enforce position-only planning, which may cause misalignment with organizational planning policies.

Description: Ensures the 'Talent Hub' configuration is present, allowing HRBPs to access the Talent Hub view for managing team planning and succession workflows.
Impact: If not configured, HRBPs will be unable to use Talent Hub features for talent management.

Description: Ensures the 'Talent Hub' tab order is configured to display team planning tabs correctly within the HRBP Talent Hub view.
Impact: If not configured, the Talent Hub may display tabs in an incorrect or confusing order for HRBPs.

Description: Ensures the team planning table columns are displayed in the correct order within the Talent Hub view for HRBPs.
Impact: If not configured, HRBPs may find the team planning table confusing or misaligned with workflow needs.

Description: Ensures the team table column configuration is aligned with the defined column order in the Talent Hub for HRBPs.
Impact: If misaligned, the team table may display incorrect columns or cause confusion for HRBPs managing talent planning.

Description: Ensures the profile search data fields are configured correctly for the HRBP Talent Hub view, aligning with the team table configuration for effective profile search.
Impact: Incorrect configuration may lead to incomplete or inaccurate search results within the Talent Hub.

Description: Ensures the filter order within the Talent Hub is configured correctly for HRBPs, supporting effective filtering during team planning and succession workflows.
Impact: If not configured, filters may appear in an illogical order, reducing usability for HRBPs.

Description: Ensures the search filters within the Talent Hub are configured correctly to support effective filtering by HRBPs during talent planning workflows.
Impact: If not configured, HRBPs may experience missing or incorrect filters, making it difficult to search and analyze employee data.

Description: Ensures that most employee profiles have the business unit (BU) field populated to support accurate organization structure and reporting.
Impact: If missing, it may affect reporting, filtering, and visibility within the Talent Hub.

Rule Name: More than {{ metric_data_json.min_threshold }}% of employees should have lob (Line of Business)
Description: Ensures that most employee profiles have the division (Line of Business, LOB) field populated to support role initialization and business function inference.
Impact: Missing LOB can impact role matching, filtering, and reporting within the Talent Hub.

Rule Name: More than {{ metric_data_json.min_threshold }}% of employees should have location
Description: Ensures that most employee profiles have a location defined to support filtering and reporting in Talent Hub and other modules.
Impact: Missing location data can limit reporting capabilities and reduce the effectiveness of location-based analysis.

Rule Name: More than {{ metric_data_json.min_threshold }}% of employees should have level
Description: Ensures that most employee profiles have a level defined to support seniority inference, role initialization, and recommendations within Talent Hub and related workflows.
Impact: Missing level data can affect role matching, seniority determination, and recommendations within the system.
